channel.title: engineering on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in engineering on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Making a career
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Look, the tech industry’s relationship with employee tenure is… weird. A year here, a year there. It’s often treated like collecting stamps.

item.title: Data Pipeline Design Framework
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Motivation of Designing Data Pipeline Framework To improve and strongly go-live the data pipeline, besides apply best practices and pillar for Data Pipeline Native Solution, a design framework and pattern are robustly help us in:

item.title: Quick Learning Vector Database
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Motivation of Vector Database The motivation of this thoughts that trying to discover the LLMs and Generative AI In order to create or build, train any models there are multiple factors will need to be considered: lakes of data, metadata, data management, infrastructure, etc.

item.title: Google Data Fusion
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Google Data Fusion is a fully managed, cloud-native data integration service that enables users to efficiently build and manage ETL/ELT data pipelines.

item.title: Google Dataproc
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Google Dataproc is a fast and easy-to-use, fully managed cloud service for running Apache Spark and Hadoop workloads. It allows users to process and analyze large-scale data efficiently and at scale.

item.title: React Native Developer
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re looking for talented developer with experience in React Native to join Dwarves and work remotely, on a fast-growing US startup.

item.title: The removal of Apache Kafka's dependency on Zookeeper
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before the removal Importance of Zookeeper Kafka has been using Zookeeper for a variety of important functions. It uses Zookeeper to keep track of which brokers are part of the Kafka cluster.

item.title: SQL and how it relates to Disk Reads and Writes
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What are random and sequential reads and writes? Random and sequential reads and writes refer to the way data is accessed, read, and written on hard disks

item.title: URL Redirect vs. Rewrite; What’s the difference?
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When working with websites and managing the computers that show them, we run into two important ideas: redirect URLs and rewrite URLs.

item.title: Forward Engineering August 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As we step into the exciting opportunities of August, we are at a crucial point in the ever-changing world of technology.

item.title: Our View On Fullstack Engineering
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In tackling challenges in the world of software development, the term “full-stack engineer” often evokes a sense of wonder. I’m reminded of my school days when our chemistry teacher explained the fundamental principles behind chemical reactions.

item.title: Adoption Of Pnpm
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We’re excited to share that the Dwarves team has officially decided to switch to pnpm as our primary package management tool.

item.title: Forward Engineering June 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As we usher in the month of June, we embrace the ever-changing landscape of technological innovation, recognizing that every twist and turn propels us forward into a world of limitless possibilities.

item.title: Render optimization in data-fetching libraries
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Data-fetching libraries are software tools or frameworks that can help improve the performance and scalability of your application by handling network requests and data processing more efficiently.

item.title: Working On A Project Interview Assessment At Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I had my fair share of interviews. Most of them are “traditional” QnA sessions, and unpaid take-home projects, and coding assessments.

item.title: How We Created An Ai Powered Interview System Using Openais Chatgpt
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The Idea While ChatGPT has garnered a lot of attention over the last few months, Ngoc Thanh, our senior software engineer, has been exploring how OpenAI’s API can expedite and elevate job interviews by distilling key candidate insights through an interactive chat interview.

item.title: Approaches To Manage Concurrent Workloads Like Worker Pools And Pipelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introduction Go provides us great and convenient ways to write concurrent programs with high performance to execute tasks concurrently (perhaps in parallel if the program is run on a machine with multiple physical cores, GOMAXPROCS are automatically set to the number of physical cores of the machine that the program is running on)

item.title: Easy Prompt Engineering For Business Use And Mitigating Risks In Llms
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Preface At Dwarves, we’ve begun creating apps with ChatGPT for some of our clients. One common problem we face is what techniques of prompt engineering should we use for cases like avoiding political interactions and defending against data leaks.

item.title: Forward Engineering May 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: The technological landscape is vast, brimming with opportunities for exploration and growth. As we stand on the brink of May, we pause to reflect on our journey thus far and chart our course forward.

item.title: Exploring Machine Learning Approaches For Fine Tuning Llama Models
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At Dwarves, we’ve been increasingly exposed to more state-of-the-art news coming from AI than ever before, of course, related to Large Language Models (LLM).

item.title: Message Queues And Streaming Platforms Eg Kafka Nats Rabbitmq
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At Dwarves Foundation, we host a few learning sessions to understand some of the technology around us. We regularly pick up topics we find interesting to dive deeper into to understand them better and present our findings.

item.title: Lessons Learned From Concurrency Practices In Blockchain Projects
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This article covers some lessons learned from working on blockchain projects, with a team that was often optimistic about transparent distributed concurrency.

item.title: Continuous Translation
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Continuous Translation (CT) is a modern approach to translation management that involves synchronizing software development and translation workflows. This means that developers, translators, and product owners work together in a continuous cycle to ensure that all translations are up-to-date and aligned with the latest software developments.

item.title: Database Designs For Multilingual Apps
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This story comes from the necessity of multi-language support across our applications. Dwarves Foundation handles a lot of international clients and there is always some level of concern for supporting multiple languages for certain apps.

item.title: Unit Testing Best Practices In Golang
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: One common issue we often tackle in backend engineering is writing test cases. In this article, we will explore the techniques for crafting effective tests in Go, discussing best practices for writing unit tests and utilizing mocks to achieve better isolation.

item.title: What is PNPM Compare To NPM/Yarn
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is PNPM? At Dwarves Foundation, we are always on the lookout for new tech. Researching PNPM was originally from research on what package manager Next.

item.title: Accelerate Project Initiation With Advanced Nextjs Boilerplate React Toolkit
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Accelerate Project Initiation with Advanced NextJS-Boilerplate & React-Toolkit In today’s fast-paced world of software development, project initiation can often be a challenging and time-consuming process, with teams facing issues such as inconsistent code quality, slow setup times, and suboptimal workflows.

item.title: Forward Engineering March 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At the intersection of technology and innovation, our engineering team at Dwarves Foundation has been driving change and pushing boundaries. As we continue to navigate the rapidly evolving landscape of software development, we remain steadfast in our commitment to seeking out the latest technologies and practices to deliver exceptional results.

item.title: How Blue Green Deployment Helped Mochi
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: At Dwarves Foundation, our team has always faced some bit of friction when deploying apps for our clients. We’ve known about blue-green deployments for a while and were recently given the chance to evaluate and demonstrate them for one of our Discord bot projects.

item.title: I18n Frontend Guideline
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In a front-end web application, locales are used to determine the language and geographic location of the user and to display the appropriate content to them.

item.title: Profiling in Go
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Profiling in Go: Gotta catch ’em all Introduction Those of you who have watched the Pokemon series will undoubtedly recognize the famous catchphrase - “Gotta catch ’em all” - that refers to the main character’s goal of catching all the Pokemon in the world.

item.description: Demystifying Monorepos: A Recap of Our Recent Sharing Session During our recent sharing session, we delved into the world of monorepos, exploring their benefits, challenges, and the tools available to manage them effectively.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: In this case study, we share our experience of transitioning from multi-repository structure to a monorepo using Turbo in our project.

item.description: Micro-Frontend - What & Why? As web applications become more complex and feature-rich, traditional frontend architectures such as monolithic will become harder to maintain, scale, and evolve.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)

item.title: Focus On Software Delivery
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Focus on shipping when you are struggling with what to do next to be better as a software engineer. When you ship something new, users will try out your build and give you feedback.

item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Hosted by Thanh Pham - Engineering Manager, Dwarves had a great time with the best minds in cybersecurity- Mr. Hieu PC to share his knowledge and experience.

item.title: MapReduce
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is MapReduce? Let’s start with an example. We are the head of census bureau for the state of California and tasked with finding the finding the population of all cities in California.

item.title: React Fiber
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: An Introduction to React Fiber Fiber is the new reconciliation algorithm since React 16, a completely backward-compatible rewrite of the old reconciler (Stack Reconciler).

item.title: Forward Proxy
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Forward proxy: is a server that sits between user devices and the internet. use for: protect clients avoid browsing restrictions block access to certain content Reverse proxy: is a server that accepts a request from the client, forwards the request to web servers, and returns the results to the client as if the proxy server had processed the request.

item.title: Data Analyst In Retail Trading
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I am Bach Phuong and I work at Dwarves Foundation as a Data Analyst, helping partner companies realize insights and understand their business better.

item.title: React Native New Architecture
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Introducing react-native’s new architecture changes that boost performance, bringing react-native back into the race with Flutter Introduction of react-native React Native is a JavaScript framework for writing high-performance mobile apps that leverage iOS and Android native components.

item.title: React 18
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: React 18 was released in March 2022. This release focuses on performance improvements and updating the rendering engine. React 18 Feature Quick Guide Now let’s look at each of these updates in more detail.

item.description: A brief comparison between Remix and Next.js frameworks Introduction of Remix Remix describes itself as: Remix is an edge native, full-stack JavaScript framework for building modern, fast, and resilient user experiences.

item.title: The Path To Growth at Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Greetings, It’s Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. We’re here with the fifth edition of our Dwarves Updates. October has been a wild ride for us as a company.

item.title: Engineer Performance Review
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Greetings, It’s Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. Time does fly when we get to do something we love. As we keep working on building up the team and producing codes for our clients, we didn’t even notice it’s already the end of September.

item.title: Are We Really Engineers
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Is software engineering “really” engineering? As the Dwarves asked this question during the Apprenticeship Training Program, we had a chance to dig more into the topic.

item.title: Go In Software Engineering
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Go is a type-safe, cloud-native language designed for simplicity with first-class support for concurrency. The software community has been hungering for a small, simple, easy-to-learn and pragmatic programming language.

item.description: Introduction In the previous century, when the software market was also immature, the economy was grown with a large scale lead to more and more new business problems appear that demands software to solve such as management, automatic.

item.title: Introduction To Software Craftsmanship
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Craftsmanship has been our motto since the first day. But to the newbies and even some current Dwarves, the real definition of software craftsmanship is still vague, or being understood in different ways.

item.description: This post ain’t gonna be a speech of Uncle Bob’s Software Craftsmanship Manifesto. We’ve all known that. And to people who don’t, for God’s sake.

item.title: What Is Kubernetes
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: What is Kubernetes Kubernetes is a portable, extensible, open-source platform for managing containerized workloads and services, that facilitates both declarative configuration and automation.

item.title: Finite State Machine
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: A Finite State Machine is a model of computation based on a hypothetical machine made of one or more states. Only one single state of this machine can be active at the same time.

item.title: Skill Of Software Engineer
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Read Code The ability to understand an existing code base in order to analyze its behavior and make fixes or enhancements to it.

item.title: The 10x Engineer
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: 10x engineer is a concept sometimes used in Silicon Valley to describe an engineer that is 10x more productive than an average engineer although the 10x metric is figurative.
